=== About Me ===

My name is S. M. Pavel Sayekat and I am using Ubuntu GNU/Linux since 2008. I tried Ubuntu 8.04 Hardy Heron as one of my senior <nowiki>[[https://web.facebook.com/asif.nashiry | alumnus]]</nowiki> gifted the
<nowiki>[[http://imgur.com/a/FU1uH | CD]]</nowiki> to me, and instantly I fell in love with Ubuntu for the themes and colour profile and the freedom to use the OS unlike other proprietary OS and for lovely & funny package naming and even the coding comments are interesting. I keep setting up other's PC with the downloaded one's. But many of them took it for granted and when they experienced problems or lag in windows env in dual-boot windows, they just formatted the whole PC and re-setup windows.  After setting-up my own pc for the first time as dual-boot, I configured the wvdial to use net through cellular phone as Internet was not easily available at that time except through Telcos in Bangladesh and then for 2.5g modems using usb-modswitch with specific code for each modems.  I tried many Linux and Ubuntu flavours and every release of Ubuntu before Ubuntu 10.04 because after that I started using "LTS only" to be a little more stable. I fixed one of my cousin <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/dipraw | dipraw's]]</nowiki> machine (Ubuntu) over the phone, being 500 Km away by helping him in grub environment, live booting an ISO which was located in a partition as he cannot make a bootable pendrive without any working system and then fixing the broken grub.

Till now The Ubuntu Community on IRC is proving very handy for me and I specially like to mention some names like <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/belkinsa | belkinsa]]</nowiki> as she gave me a head-start otherwise I might not even face the <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Membership/Boards | Membership Board]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/inetpro | inetpro]]</nowiki> with <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Kilos | Kilos]]</nowiki> for doing some basic fixes on me and <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/elacheche | elacheche]]</nowiki> being so supportive and friendly, <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~theblazehen | theblazehen]]</nowiki> for being awesomely helpful technically, <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/chesedo | chesedo]]</nowiki> from Ubuntu-za as a friendly hand, <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/wxl | wxl]]</nowiki> for guiding me on system troubleshooting , <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Thomas%20Ward | teward]]</nowiki> for guiding me with where to find what, of course with the help of his coffee, <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/MahayAlamKhan | maktrix]]</nowiki> for his advices on doing translations (oops! on Telegram.),  <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/tsimonq2 | tsimonq2]]</nowiki> for that I copied some of his contexts and still following :p,  <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Unit193 | Unit193]]</nowiki> being in the Xubuntu team, <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Bashing-om | Bashing-om]]</nowiki> helping me fixing an issue with system cloning, keeping an eye on me on <nowiki>[[https://ubuntuforums.org | ubuntuforums.org]]</nowiki> and for hanging out with me on IRC, <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~flocculant | flocculant]]</nowiki> for guiding me on Bug Reporting, <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~krytarik | kryten]]</nowiki> mmmmm, the person mentioned last, helps me without even being asked, can you guys believe it?

Damped Systems under supervision of M. Abul Kawser AKA <nowiki>[[https://web.facebook.com/kawserma | Tuhin Kawser]]</nowiki>. I used C with GCC in Ubuntu to test the perturbation method and to analyse the results in comparison to Runge-Kutta method.
